loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias joined GDMPC in 2012. He gained access to micro finance and it helped him to improve his ability to engage in his business. To make a living, he manages his own rice farm and earns a good living. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer in order to improve his farm. Elias is thankful to GDMPC for helping him become successful on his farm. In the future, Elias wants to have another plot of farmland to expand his rice fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a member of this three-person lending group. She has asked for a Kiva loan from Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Lubna lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband owns a spare parts shop in the market where he sells automobile spare parts. 

Currently, he is in need of finance to purchase a variety of automobile spare parts to sell, as his shop's stock is finished. He does not have enough savings to purchase the products needed for his shop.

Therefore, Lubna wants to help her husband with the loan amount. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband to continue his work. She wishes for the success of her husband's business and for a bright future for their children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married mother of two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Maimuna operates a business selling clothes and shoes, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. Maimuna decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and lives at Pines, Oroquieta City, Mindanao, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she raises pigs in their backyard. She sells one pig at a time. With the desire to earn more, she decided to raise more pigs so that she can sell more. 

Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative has financed her original heads of piglets & the feed. Now, she requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional heads of piglets and sacks of feed. Lolita really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 56 years old. and a widow with three adult children. She lives in Mabini Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She engages in a snack vending business and earns 3,500 PHP a month. She has been in this business for 15 years. Linda requested a new loan to purchase kilos of flour and sugar for snack vending. Linda has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for 13 years.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim sells cooked food from home to the general public. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the KSHS 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase foodstuff like maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes, disinfectants, women's perfumes, and colognes.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 37 years old. She is married and has one grade school student. She lives in Mabini Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Lina has been engaged in her sari-sari store business for five years and earns a monthly income of PHP 4,000. She requested a new loan to purchase beverages and various groceries for additional sales to her customers. Lina has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2000 and aims to have more savings for future use.

loans.use: To purchase beverages and various groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a married woman and a mother to a two-year-old child. She is 29 years old and comes from Loboc, Bohol. Rosalie has been engaged in the hog-raising business for five years. Rosalie is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise and then sell in three to four months time. Through this loan, she will be able to put her plans into action in order to earn more. In the future, Rosalie dreams of expanding her piggery and becoming a successful businesswoman. She will also save for the future education of her child.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en: Jojie is 50 years old. She is married and has two adult children, both of whom are married already. Her husband is a private employee. She lives in SWP Calamba MIsamis Occidental. Jojie has been engaged in the flower sales business since she really loves flowers. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000. She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for 13 years.

loans.use: To purchase pots and flowers to sell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 37-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to take a loan to support her husband. He is a salesman. His daily practice is to take rubber bands from wholesalers and deliver them to the retailers via his bike. Nowadays, he observed, the household expenses are exceeding the income. So, he decided to increase his efforts regarding the business. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan so that her husband can buy rubber bands in a larger quantity to deliver to the retailers.

Naseem hopes that now her husband can easily establish his business and can contribute more to the household expenses than before. Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy rubber bands to sell

loans.name: Diloromkhon

texts.ru: Дилоромхон добрая женщина. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем, но ее муж 7 лет назад уехал в Российскую Федерацию на заработки, но без вести пропал. Дилоромхон не знает, жив он или мертв. Она сама воспитывает и обеспечивает 5 детей. Дилоромхон с 1998 года занимается собственным бизнесом. Она продает ткани на местном рынке. Она приобретает свой товар со столичного рынка и продает на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку. В этом году у нее было много расходов, так как двое из ее дочерей учатся в университете, и она оплатила за их учебный договор. Она не имеет денег, для покупки товара, так как она нуждается обновления товара для нового сезона. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Diloromkhon is a kind woman of 38 years.  She is married, however, 7 years ago, her husband left to work in the Russian Federation and disappeared without a trace.  Diloromkhon does not know if he is dead or alive.  She is raising and supporting her five children by herself.  

Since 1998, Diloromkhon has been carrying out her own business of selling fabrics at the local market.  She purchases her merchandise in the capital city and sells it locally from her stall at the market.  This year, she had to pay for the university tuition of her two daughters.  She does not have any money to purchase new merchandise for the coming season.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to purchase fabrics.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to sell at the market

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema operates a fish-selling business. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale and she appreciates the great support of the previous loan. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en: Sergia is 51 years old. She is married and has nine children, eight of whom are still studying and one is now an adult. Her husband is a farmer. She lives in Siloy Calamba Misamis Occidental and has been engaged in the vegetable gardening business for 15 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 5,000. Sergia requested a new loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for her garden. Sergia has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for four years now.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her garden

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is married with one child. Emerenciana is 64 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Emerenciana operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for two months.  Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14900 for additional capital.

Emerenciana has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Emerenciana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Эту милую леди с зелеными глазами зовут Хосият. Она из деревни города Вахдат. Хосият гордо носит имя жены и мамы. Она работает продавщицей продуктов питания в магазине города Вахдат. Хосият продает печение, пряники, прожженное, разные сладости и безалкогольные напитки. Хосият планирует взять кредит и пополнить свои полки новыми товарами, в том числе тортами, хлебобулочными изделиями и разными видами конфет. Таким способом она расширит свою деятельность и увеличит свой доход. Хосият надеется на Вашу доброту!
texts.en: They call this lovely lady with green eyes, Khosiyat.  She is from a village of Vahdat, where she works at a grocery store selling cookies, cakes, various sweets and soft drinks.  Khosiyat is proud to tell everyone that she is a wife and a mother.  Khosiyat is asking for a loan so she can fill her shelves with cakes, breads and an assortment of candy.  With this approach, she is hoping to expand her business and to increase her profit.  Khosiyat is hoping for your kindness!

loans.use: To expand the assortment of her merchandise

loans.name: Karam Group

texts.en:
Ernalyn is the featured borrower of Karam's group. She and the other two group members are partnering to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have been friends since they came to work in Lebanon as housekeepers. They came to Lebanon to earn money to provide their families with the best education and a better living.

Ernalyn misses her hometown in the Philippines, but she insists on working hard to support her family. Her loan from Al Majmoua will be sent to her children to pay for their school fees.

Ernalyn is the woman in the center of the picture, with a white top. Lilibeth is on the left with a light green top, and Maribeth is on the right with a red shirt.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a 61-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working in the education sector for the last 15 years. In 2010, she started working as a tutor from her house, as a step towards having her own business and developing her family's living. 

Vera is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her child's increasing school fees. 

She supports her husband and family a lot and she works hard to provide them with anything they might need. Vera hopes to stay in good health to keep on supporting her family.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle, age 32, is happy tending her little store. She is married with four kids and her husband is a tricycle driver. The store is their other means of  income. Fortunately, Anabelle's store is located in a populated neighborhood, so she achieves good daily sales. The store continues to be successful even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that, with PMPC's support, they will sustain their business and beat the competition.  

Anabelle has been a member of Paglaum MPC for one year. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can continue as a member in good standing. Anabelle is a hardworking mother and wishes to manage the store so that she can provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store (general store).

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Meet Dominic, one of Juhudi Kilimo's farmers. He lives in Murang'a where he has been doing mixed farming for 40 years. His income comes from the sale of tea, eggs and a few crops. He loves farming becuse it always has good returns as long as there is favorable weather. His challenge is the lack of a well-established market and lack of piped water.

Dominic chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are affordable and their interest rates are cheaper. This loan will help him purchase a water tank to have an easy flow of water to his crops. This will make the crops produce more.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира жизнерадостная женщина с юга Таджикистана. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Нодира для того, чтобы обеспечить своих детей со всеми необходимыми средствами несколько лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не отправляет регулярно денег, поэтому Нодира надеется только на свой доход. Нодира всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети жили в хороших условиях. Однако ее дом имеет плохое состояние и нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Нодира планирует до наступления зимы отремонтировать свой дом. Она хочет, чтобы Новый год они встретили в уютном доме. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как краски, шпаклевки, обои и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nodira is a cheerful woman from the south of Tajikistan.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children.  Her kids are attending high school.  In order  to provide all of the necessities for them, a few years ago, Nodira started her own business of selling children's clothing.  She is hoping that her income will cover all of the needed expenses.  Her husband is working abroad in the Russian Federation but does not send back money regularly.  

Nodira has always dreamed of her children living in good conditions.  However, her house is in bad need of repairs.  Nodira is planning to fix her house before the winter arrives.  She hopes to celebrate the New Years in a home that is warm and cozy.  She is asking for a loan for 4,000 somoni to purchase building materials such as paint, plaster and wall paper.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials so she can repair her house

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic grew up in the Muthurwa estate of Nairobi, Kenya with his mother and three siblings. He ventured into the car wash business immediately after high school since he wasn't able to go to college and needed a source of income to help with his family's upkeep. He has been washing cars for a living for the past three years. When he found the opportunity to invest in Fresh Life toilets, he took keen interest and thought of it as a good source of additional income. 

Dominic wishes to use the Fresh Life toilets to create employment opportunities for other youth once his franchise grows. He, therefore, seeks a loan to help him purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a widowed woman and has been blessed with three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Maria is requesting Kshs 30,000 to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Hermes Guadalupe

texts.es: Hermes vive con su familia en casa propia, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela que lo prefieren por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas cubre algunos gastos e su hogar, Hermes está solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor como tomates, cebollas, papayas, papas, etc. y así poder seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Hermes lives with his family in the home they own. He sells fruits and vegetables out of his home. He has a lot of customers who prefer him because of his good prices and friendly demeanor at the store. His profits are enough to cover some of the costs of his home. Hermes is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale, like tomatoes, onions, papayas, potatoes, etc. This way he can continue with his business and be able to give his family what they need without limitations.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale, like tomatoes, onions, papayas, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар живет в районе Хамадони. Ему 39 лет. Он имеет высшее образование и последние три года работает в микро кредитном депозитном организации в качестве кредитного офицера. Жена Диловара домохозяйка, а дочь и сыновья учатся в школе. Таким образом Диловар единственный кормилец семьи. Он решил начать собственный бизнес и будет совмещать со своей основной работой. Диловар давно интересуется купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. У него при дворе дома имеется коровник. Диловар накопил сбережение в размере 1500 долларов и еще просит в кредит 2100 долларов. Он на сумму кредита и сбережения планирует купить 5 голов коров и телят, а также корм для скота. Жена Диловара будет помогать ему в бизнесе. В его отсутствии она будет кормить и поить скот. Для Диловара этот кредит очень важен. Ведь он будет обеспечивать семью не только молоком и мясом, но и дополнительным доходом.
texts.en:
Dilovar lives in Hamadoni.  He is 39 years old.  He has a university education and for the last three years, he has been working at a microfinance bank as a loan manager.  Dilovar's wife is a homemaker, and his daughter and sons attend school.  Currently, Dilovar is the only breadwinner in the family.  He decided to start his own business that he will run in parallel with his regular work.  For a while now, Dilovar has been interested in cattle sales.  He has a cowshed in his yard. 

Dilovar saved 1,500 dollars and is asking for a loan of 2,100 dollars.  He is planning to use this money to purchase five cows, calves and some feed.  Dilovar's wife will be helping him run this business.  During his absence, she will feed and water the animals.  This loan is very important to Dilovar, since he is providing his family not only with milk, but also with a supplemental income.

loans.use: To purchase 5 cows, calves and some feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic and cement.

loans.name: Tadzhikhon

texts.ru: Таджихон родилась в 1951 года. Она вдова и имеет 5 детей. Таджихон имеет высшее образование. Она в течение многих лет работала агрономом. Данное время она пенсионерка и дома занимается предоставлением услуги швеи, так как она очень опытная портниха. Таджихон любит своё дело и с удовольствием выполняет ее. Ее невестка помогает ей введению бизнеса. Таджихон последнее время много болеет. Она должна лечиться, так как врачи предупредили ее о серьёзности ее болезни. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6200 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tadzhikhon was born in 1951.  She is a widow and has five children.  Tadzhikhon has a university education and for many years she had worked as an agronomist.  Currently, she is retired and works as a seamstress as well as a tailor.  Tadzhikhon loves her work and performs it with pleasure.  Her daughter-in-law helps her run the business.  Recently, Tadzhikhon has fallen ill.  She has a serious condition which requires treatment.  She is asking for a loan of 6,200 somoni to purchase medicine to treat herself.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy medicine to treat herself

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she wants to purchase six bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 28-year old married woman, who lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a bike rental business where he rents out motorbikes to the general people. He has been doing this work for many years. It requires him to stay at the shop to deal with his customers. He wants to buy a new bike to meet demand but has not been able to purchase one due to the high cost.

This will be Maryam's first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that, with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time. 

Maryam thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional bike to rent out to the general public.

loans.name: Kholbiby

texts.ru: Холбиби несколько лет назад потеряла своего мужа, так как он был болен. Ей 47 лет. Она кормилица 2 детей. Она свет в жизни детей и единственная надежда для них. Холбиби 5 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей риса на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Ее сын помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов и поэтому хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки риса для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: A few years ago, Kholbiby lost her husband to illness.  She is 47 years old and is raising two children.  She is both the sun and the hope for her children.  Five years ago, Kholbiby started her own business of selling rice at the local market where she has her own stall.  Her son is helping her with running this business.  She has a set of permanent clients, and she wants to expand her working capital.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase rice to replenish her stocks.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy rice to replenish her stocks and to increase her working capital

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru: Гулчахон порядочная женщина. Ей 46 лет. Она разведена и имеет 4 детей. Много лет назад ее муж бросил ее с 4 детьми и не помогал по содержанию детей. Она работала в средней школе учительницей и получала маленькую зарплату. Таким образом, с большим трудом она вырастила своих детей. Двое ее дочери замужем, и имеют своё домохозяйство. Двое ее сыновья учатся в средней школе. Она хочет, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование и стали высококвалифицированными специалистами. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2700 сомони для оплаты учебного договора своей дочери, которая учится в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Guljahon is a respectable woman.  She is 46 years old, widowed and is raising four children.  Many years ago, her husband left her and her children and did not help them financially.  At the time, she had been working as a school teacher and was receiving a small salary.  With great difficulty, she was able to raise her children.  Two of her daughters are now married and are running their own households.  Two of her sons are studying in high school.  She wants her children to receive university education and to become qualified specialists.  She is asking for a loan of 2700 somoni to pay for her daughter's university tuition.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her daughter

loans.name: Musallam

texts.ru: Мусаллам родилась в 1968 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж простой фермер. Мусаллам более 12 лет занимается садоводством. Она имеет абрикосовый сад. Она продает свой продукт, как в свежем виде, так и в виде сухо фрукта. Мусаллам всегда мечтала иметь высшее образование, но ее мечта не сбылась. Теперь она старается, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Сын Мусаллама учится в Военной Академии Республики Таджикистана. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Musallam was born in 1968. She is married and raising three children. Her husband is a simple farmer. Musallam has been a gardener for more than 12 years and has an apricot orchard. She sells both fresh and dried apricots. 

She always dreamed of getting a higher education, but never realized that dream. Now she wants to ensure that her children get a higher education. Her son studies in the Military Academy of the Republic of Tajikistan. She doesn't have the money to pay her son's school tuition, and so is asking for a loan to be able to pay them. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education expenses.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad vive en casa de su padre junto con su familia, desde hace 15 años posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela porque tiene surtido su negocio y los clientes siempre encuentran lo que buscan, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería como granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, azúcar, shampoo, etc. y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José, 41, lives with his family in his father's house. For 15 years he has run a store in his home. He has a lot of customers because he keeps his business stocked and people always find what they are looking for. With the profits from his sales he is able to cover some of the costs of his home. José is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like basic grains, oil, snacks, sugar, shampoo, etc so that he can earn more money to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, snacks, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора добросовестная женщина. Ей 43 года. Она 23 года назад потеряла своего мужа. Ее муж погиб в автокатастрофе. Она осталась вдовой с маленьким ребенком. Гулнора не вышла больше замуж и посвятила всю свою жизнь своему сыну. Данное время ее сыну 24 года. Гулнора работает в заводе по разработки алюминий. Она является одной из успешных работников. Гулнора получает маленькую зарплату и с трудом справляется с семейными расходами. Она имеет очень хорошую сестру, которая собирается выйти замуж. Гулнора желает добра и счастья своей сестре и поэтому она хочет помочь своей сестре, для того, чтобы организовать ее свадебное торжество. Гулнора запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества ее сестры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a conscientious 43-year-old woman. Twenty-three years ago she lost her husband in a car accident. She became a widow with a small child. She did not marry again, and instead devoted her life to her son who is now 24 years old. 

Gulnora works in an aluminum factory, where she is one of the most successful employees. She receives a small salary and has difficulty covering her family's expenses. She has a very good sister who is getting married. Gulnora wishes her sister good luck and wants to help by organizing her wedding reception. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 TJS for it, and waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To plan a wedding reception for her sister.

loans.name: Komila

texts.ru: Комила жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Ее сыну 18 лет. Муж Комилы работает в средней школе и получает маленькую зарплату. Комила взяла обеспечение семьи на себя, так как ее муж зарабатывает слишком мало денег. Комила занимается выращивание сельхоз культур как картофель, пшеница и т.п. Она более 19 лет занимается этим бизнесом. Комила и ее семья живут в старом домике, который имеет плохое состояние. Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 650 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Komila is a cheerful woman who is married with one 18-year-old son. Her husband works in a high school and earns a small salary. Komila took over providing for the family because her husband makes too little money.

For over 19 years she has farmed crops like potatoes, wheat, etc.. Komila and her family live in a small old house which is poorly constructed. She wants to repair it, and has asked for a loan of US$650 to buy the building supplies. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Hexiell Abigail

texts.es: Hexiell de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar. Hexiell está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, etc. para poder surtir mas su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitaciones alguna.
texts.en:
Hexiell, 31 years old, lives in her own home with her spouse and her six-year-old child. She has a small shop in her home. With what she makes off her sales and with the help of her spouse, she manages to pay for their household expenses.

Hexiell is requesting a loan to buy bulk grains, sugar, oil, candies, etc., in order to better stock her business and make better earnings. This will allow her to give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, sugar, oil, candies, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Leonel

texts.es:
Carlos  de 38 años de edad, sus estudios los realizo hasta 9° grado, el motivo por el cual, no pudo seguir estudiando; es por que en ese tiempo no existía el nivel de bachillerato, desde entonce comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura y en la albañilería con su padre; luego con el tiempo se independizo realizando su propio trabajo de construir casas y de remodelación. 

Su familia esta conformada, por su esposa que se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo  y han procreado 4 hijos; dos varones que se encuentran en los estados unidos y los otros dos están con ellos, uno de los que están con ellos, estudia en la escuela, que esta cerca  escuela, el pequeño  pasa con su mamá. 


En la construcción de viviendas y remodelación de las mismas, lo viene realizando desde hace 14 años;  oficio que aprendió por parte de su padre, quien le enseño y en su tiempo libre trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra del frijol y del maíz.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para terminar una parte de la casa que es el techo de la cochera. Con esto mejorara en mucho, porque así podrá vender la casa y tener un mejor ingreso.
 
 Carlos piensa en instalar un negocio propio en el pueblo  y que los niños terminen sus estudios
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old and studied until the 9th grade. He wasn't able to continue to study after that because high school didn't exist at the time. He then began to work in agriculture and construction with his father. Later, with time, he became independent and began to do his own work building houses and doing remodelling. 

Carlos's family is made up of his wife, who works selling products from a catalogue, and their four children. They have two boys who are in the United States and the other two children are with them. One of the children that lives with them goes to school, which is close to their home, and the little one stays with his mother.

Carlos has been building and remodelling homes for 14 years. He learned this trade from his father, who taught him. In his free time, Carlos works in agriculture, growing beans and corn.

He is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy materials to finish a part of his house - the roof of the garage. This will improve things a lot, because he will be able to sell the house and have a better income in this way.

Carlos plans to start his own business in his village, and hopes that his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building the roof of his garage.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 46 años, es casada y vive en su casa propia hecha de material noble junto a su esposo e hijos.
Su trabajo y principal actividad es la agricultura puesto que desde muy joven no tenía conocimientos de otro oficio y  fue un oficio que aprendió desde muy niña por sus padres. Cuenta permanentemente con el apoyo de su Esposo e hijos en labores menores haciendo de este un oficio familiar.Cuenta con dos hectáreas de terreno que sus padres le cedieron y donde posee una variedad de productos como cacao orgánico, café, barbasco y árboles frutales. Le agrada mantener en buen estado sus cultivos y desempeña una agricultura responsable haciendo uso exclusivo de abono orgánico. Suele contratar trabajadores para que le apoyen a realizar tareas complicadas como el retiro de maleza y cosecha de sus productos ya que es la única manera de agilizar las tareas pendientes.
Es el tercer préstamo que solicita con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Blanca, 46, is married and, together with her husband and children, lives in her own home made of solid materials. She has been a farmer since a very young age, a trade that she learned from her parents, and the only job she knows. She always has the support of her husband and children in the small tasks required of this job. She has two hectares of land that her parents gave her, and grows a variety of products like organic cacao, coffee, barbasco and tree fruits. She likes keeping her crops in good condition and practices responsible agriculture using only organic compost. She usually hires laborers to do the complicated tasks like weeding and harvesting the crops, since that is the only way to streamline the work.

This is her third Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue moving forward. She promises to make her payments punctually. She would like to have 1000 PEN to buy organic compost.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Farishtamo

texts.ru:
Фариштамо жительница района Фархор. Ей 54 года. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее старший сын находится на заработках в России. Дочка и младший сын Фариштамо живут вместе с ней. Фариштамо домохозяйка. Ее муж работает на поле. Он имеет 4 гектаров земли, где занимается растениеводством. Фариштамо ему помогает. 
    Фариштамо взяв пример со своих соседей и земляков решила начать свой бизнес по покупке и продаже крупнорогатых скотов. В Таджикистане основные деятельности является скотоводство и растениеводство. Фариштамо просит кредит, чтобы приобрести маленьких скотов. Она купит маленьких бычков и телят после 30-35 дней откорма продаст их на скотном рынке. Сумму, которую просит Фариштамо является маленьким для бизнеса которую она начинает. Фариштамо надеется, что она достигнет своей цели и сможет начать свой бизнес. Она верит, что ей помогут, и она реализует свою мечту.
texts.en:
Farishtamo is a resident of the Farkhor district.  She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  Her oldest son is currently working in Russia.  Her daughter and youngest son still live with her.  Farishtamo is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer.   He owns four hectares (9.88 acres) of land and is involved in agriculture.  Farishtamo helps him with his farming business.

Following the example of her neighbors and fellow countrymen, Farishtamo has decided to launch her own business which will consist in buying and selling livestock.  Tajikistan's main sectors of activity  are crop farming and cattle breeding.  Farishtamo is taking a loan which she will use to buy young livestock.  She will buy young bulls and calves, will feed them for 30 to 35 days and then resell them at the cattle market.  The sum that she is requesting for this loan is quite small for the type of business she is planning to launch.

Farishtamo hopes to be able to reach her goals and to start her new business.  She has confidence that she will receive help, which will help her to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and get involved in animal husbandry.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en: Pastora operates her retail business in addition to farming to earn a living.  Pastora has been in her business for 12 years and she has been able to sustain their living. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and her previous loan that she used for her store was successfully repaid. Currently, she borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer for the farm. In the future, Pastora hopes to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano, es un agricultor que cuanta con una familia formada por su esposa, cinco hijos y el, todos viven juntos, sus hijos estudian mientras él y su esposa trabajan en las labores agrícolas. Los conocimientos que tiene de la agricultura los aprendió de su padre y hoy es la forma que tiene para generar los ingresos necesarios para aportar en los gastos de su hogar.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, insecticidas, que son los recursos que necesita para preparar la tierra y sembrar la postrera de maíz. Espera tener un mejor trato para su cultivo, mejores ingresos, una cosecha mayor a la de años anteriores.
Sueña con crecer en su negocio, mejorar su economía, pues sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan buena alimentación, salud y educación superior de calidad.
texts.en:
Mariano is a farmer whose family is made of his wife, five children, and himself. All of them live together. His children go to school, while he and his wife work in agriculture. Mariano gained his knowledge of agriculture from his father, and today it is the way he earns the income he needs to cover his household expenses.

He will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and insecticides, which are the resources he needs to prepare the earth and to plant his crop of corn. He hopes to have better treatments for his crops, better earnings, and a larger harvest than in previous years.

He dreams of growing his business and improving his financial situation, since his children are growing and need good food and health as well as high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.ru:
Степан – из Берегово. Он работает частным предпринимателем уже 29 лет, ремонтирует автомобили, у него много своих клиентов. 
Степан живет в своем доме, как и большинство жителей Берегово. Наступают холода, температура опускается ниже нуля. Поэтому Степан хотел бы модернизировать систему отопления в доме, чтобы обеспечить своей семье тепло зимой. Дело в том, что котел и трубопроводы отопительной системы устаревшие, и из-за дырявых труб пропадает вода из системы и воздух попадает в радиаторы, за счет чего они не греются. Для установки нового котла и труб необходима сумма в 20 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Stepan is from Beregovo.  For the past 29 years, he has been working as a private entrepreneur, providing car repair services to many clients.

Like the majority of Berogovo's residents, Stepan lives in his own house.  With the arrival of the cold season, temperatures sometimes drop below zero.  For this reason, Stepan would like to update the heating system inside his house, to make sure that his family stays warm this winter.  His house's boiler as well as his heating system's pipes are obsolete: water is leaking through the pipes and air gets into the radiators, so they are no longer heating.  

Stepan needs 20,000 Hryvnia to install a new boiler and replace the pipes of his heating system.

loans.use: to upgrade the heating system in his house.

loans.name: Adolfa

texts.en: Adolfa is a 55-year-old married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for five years now. She is determined to make her hogs healthy in order to have a better return of her investment. Adolfa is requesting a loan to buy piglets, supplements and feed. In the future, Adolfa dreams of expanding her business and building a bigger piggery for increased income. Her profit allows her to save and pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy piglets, supplements, and feed.

loans.name: Niko

texts.en:
Niko is 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two daughters in the small village of Lagodekhi district. Niko works hard on the family-owned land, growing maize. He always has high quality product, which is sold locally at a good price. In addition, he has three pigs. 

Niko decided to expand the husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $1,900 for purchasing a cow and calves. He will start producing cheese to sell, as well as for family use. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and calves.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина живет и работае в городе Дрогобыч. Она работает в финансовой компании. У Ирины есть муж и двое  маленьких дочек. 
Ирина планирует делать ремонт дома. Для этого ей необходима сумма в 10 000 гривен. Ирина так мечтает обустроить свой дом и сделать его более уютным для своих дочерей, но собственных средств на все не хватает. Поэтому она и рассчитывает на содействие КИВА.
texts.en:
Irina lives and works in the city of Drogobych.  She works for a financial company.  She is married and the mother of two young daughters.  

Irina is planning to repair her house, and she needs 10,000 Hryvnia to do so.  Her dream is to renovate her house and make it more comfortable for her daughters, but she doesn't have enough money.  She is therefore counting on KIVA's assistance.

loans.use: to completely remodel her house.

loans.name: Yoweri

texts.en:
Yoweri is a farmer who grows tea for sale so that he can support his family by providing for the family members using the money he gets as profit from the sale of tea. He works four days on the tea farm and spends three hours on the farm per day. He started tea farming in 2008 and has sustained the business to date despite the challenges involved. 

The tea farm is located in a village in Butare, and he is determined to expand it given the opportunity of additional capital in the form of a loan. Yoweri has a motorcycle that he uses to carry people at a relatively small fee to get additional income, and this really helps him, especially when it's not a season for harvesting tea. 

He would like to use the loan money of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy fertilizers to boost the fertility of the soil so that he can harvest in big quantities and get better profits. He is very hopeful that his business will grow from one level to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his tea farm.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Sarah, who carries out farming in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She has carried out farming for 30 years, and her source of income comes from the sale of milk and crops like maize, potatoes and bananas. She faces the challenge of there being no market for her products, but when she is able to get a ready market, she enjoys the profit she earns out of it.

Sarah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. She also learned that MFIs [micro-finance institutions] do encourage small-scale farmers to develop a lifestyle of saving.

This loan will help her start up an agrovet business that will also provide her crops and livestock with pest and disease controllers, thus causing them to produce more. This will improve her income base and hence, improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To start up an agrovet business that will also provide her crops and livestock with pest and disease controllers.

loans.name: Zebra Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her late 30's, is married with four children. Three of  them are still at school and one has finished studying.  She has been running a beauty salon for five years now.  She works from 8 AM to 9 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sharifa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more salon equipment so that her salon will set a high standard.  She dreams of having an international salon.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, Zebra, which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment and so that her salon will set a high standard

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is married with four children helped her husband in running their transportation service based business in the community of Oroquieta City. Her husband is the one operating the motorcycle carrying passengers and baggage for five years to earn a living. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit for motorcycle maintenance costs. Her future plan for the business is to acquire another unit of motorcycle for business expansion. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family .

loans.use: for motorcycle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Марьяна живет и работает в Королево. Ей 35 лет, она в разводе, у нее двое детей. Она работает с среднеобразовательной школе техничкой. Работает уже 7 лет. Более того, дома у нее большое хозяйство: куры, свиньи и т.д.), что приносит ей дополнительный доход. 
Марьяне нужна сумма в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать на кухне косметический ремонт. Дом у нее старенький, давно не делался ремонт. Поэтому с кухни Марьяна и хотела бы начать. Сама не могла потянуть ремонт только на свои средства, так зарабатывает немного, еще и много расходов с детьми.
texts.en:
Maryana lives and works in Korolyovo, Ukraine.  She is 35 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children.  For the past seven years she has been working as a maintenance person at a secondary school.  Besides her job, she also keeps many farm animals at home (chickens, pigs etc.), from which she derives an additional income.

Maryana needs 5,000 Hryvnia to perform some light repairs in her kitchen.  Her house is quite old and hasn't been repaired for a while, and Maryana has decided to start with the kitchen.  She cannot afford to pay for these repairs on her own because she makes little money and has a lot of children-related expenses.

loans.use: to perform some repairs in her kitchen.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional sack of rice to sell.

Maryjane has been in this business for three years. Maryjane earns additional income from a general store.

Maryjane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sack of rice to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, tires, paints, etc. for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Analyn has been in this business for 8 years. Analyn earns more income from buy-and-sell dry goods.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, tires, paints, etc. for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rochie

texts.en:
Rochie is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rochie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

Rochie has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a single man; he describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell. He describes his family challenge to be water shortage. 

He will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a 1,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 1,000 litre water tank

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking mother with two children. She runs a hog-raising business, particularly hogs for breeding. Beatriz learned this kind of business from her parents. Since her parents died already, Beatriz kept this business up to this time. She has been running this business for 30 years. After disposal of her hogs, she then immediately bought the daily needs of her family.

Beatriz wants to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed for maintenance of her hogs. She is hoping for approval of her requested loan, so she can operate the business well and be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed for maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of having a partner in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is a fifty-year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past 26 years she and her husband have run a food stall to cover all of the family’s living expenses and their children's education fees.

Minh has borrowed and successfully repaid money through CEP before. She would now like to take a further loan to buy food and beverages for her food stall. 

Minh hopes that this loan of 20,000,000 VND will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages for her food stall

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is aged 21 years old and married. She is the mother of one daughter. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice twenty-two years and supplement their family’s income by planting rubber trees and to better support her big family, they sometimes work for others for a fee. 

Mom’s group consists of four female members who live in the same village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is the second cycled client while the other two members are just the first cycled clients with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Mom, who is the leader, will user her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en:
Chamroen is 41 years old.  She is a married mother who lives in the Banon District of Battambang Province.  She plants rice and raises pigs and cows.  With 10 years of experience in these businesses, she is able to earn up to 8 USD per day and to keep 1 USD each day as savings. 

Chamroen is just with VisionFund for this loan cycle.  Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s university tuition.  She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also that it will help to relieve her family's financial burden so that she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university’s tuition fee

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is married with six children. Melecia is fifty years old and lives in Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Melecia is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for twenty years. She requested a of five thousand pesos to buy additional bags of farm inputs.                                                           

Melecia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Melecia hopes to harvest more corn crops.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Yesua

texts.en:
Yesua is a 33-year-old man. He is married to Nonci, a 31-year-old lady. They are blessed with two children: Wardi, 12, in sixth grade of elementary school, and Dicky, 7. 

To cover his family's needs and education fees, Yesua works as a motor taxi driver. Yesua has been involved in this business for these past four years. The generated income is unstable and insufficient to meet the family’s needs, as well as Wardi’s schooling expenses. 

This situation has led Yesua to initiate a new business, which is selling mobile phone credit. To start the business, Yesua needs a capital amount of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone credit to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 32 years old and married. She has two primary school-aged children. She lives in Bonifacio Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a carpenter. Jennifer is engaged in a livestock business, raising animals such as chickens and piglets. She could earn a monthly income of 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. Jennifer requested a new loan to additonally purchase materials for use in renovating their kitchen. She became a new Member of Credit Union Microfinance Innovation of PMPC and hopes to maintain a member in good standing with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase materials for use in renovating their kitchen.

loans.name: Nonci

texts.en:
Nonci, who is 35 years old, is married to Aloysius, who is 40. They are blessed with three children, namely Dedi, 16, 1st grade of senior high school; Deo, 12, 1st grade of junior high school; and Yosi, 6, 1st grade of elementary school.

Nonci is a farmer.  Twice a week she goes to the market to sell her agricultural produce, such as corn, cassava leaves, fresh pumpkin leaves, etc. The income from selling the products is spent to buy food for her family.

In order to generate more income, Nonci would like to sell  another   type of vegetables, such as string beans, gourds, water spinach, and mustard greens. Therefore, she has requested a loan from TLM in amount of IDR 10,000,000 to buy the seeds of the additional  type of  vegetables as  mentioned  above. 

She is expecting to generate more income from the business to help in financing to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy the seeds of string beans, gourds, water spinach, and mustard greens

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a manicure (services) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials/tools like nipper, nail cutter, nail polish, etc., for her manicure (services) business.

Mila has been in this business for 26 years. Mila earns other income from buying and selling spices.

Mila has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like nipper, nail cutter, nail polish, etc., for her services

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is 50 years old and is married. He and his wife have been running a business of selling leather shoes for 10 years. Sang started this business to cover his expenses and raise two sons. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Sang is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying many kind of shoes for selling so that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy many kind of shoes for selling.

loans.name: Yerr's Group

texts.en:
Aged 55 years old, Yerr is a widowed mother of five children living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Bean planting is the main source of family’s income and supplementing the income by selling grocery items and snacks. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is able to earn about 16,000KHR per day, but she can save about 4,000KHR each after daily expenses. 

Yerr has been a member of VisionFund for eight cycles ago, and she completely repaid the past loans, which has enabled her to better support her family and have some money. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Yerr, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her bean healthfully and sells it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Trieu

texts.en:
Trieu is 51 years old, and is married. He and his wife have been running business of selling fertilizers for 10 years. He started this business to cover his expenses and raise his two sons. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Trieu is requesting a loan to expand his business by offering a larger quantity and variety of fertilizers that he will use to increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that through the loan, he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest to his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to sell at his business.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 51, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including three sons, and one daughter. She is widowed and supports her family through her business producing slippers. Mai is sometimes unable to provide the volume of slippers required by her customers. Consequently, she would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of materials such as rubber to make slippers and increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials such as rubber to produce and sell slippers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy and sell rice grains. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail cutter, nipper, pusher and other tools for her manicure business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail cutter, nipper, pusher and other tools.

loans.name: Korm

texts.en:
Korm is 33 years old and married. He has three children to support; one is too young for schooling and two are in school. To earn a living, he does rice farming and works for others for a fee. 

Including this loan, he is a sixth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of his past loans enabled him to improve his lifestyle in a gradual pace. 

For this cycle, he is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, pay for labor cost, as well as buy insecticide for his crop. He hopes that he can gain triple yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labor cost, as well as buy insecticide for his crop.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is from  Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Ocidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She  is  55 years old and is married with six kids. 

In 2008, Flordeliza applied her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of  member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Presently, Flordeliza is asking for financial assistance in the amount of Php 14,900 to pay for additional kilograms of fruit for her fruit vending business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for additional kilograms of fruit for her fruit vending business

loans.name: Kashif Ali

texts.en:
The person who is shown in the picture is named Kashif Ali. He is 25 years old and lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been successfully running a small general store for many years. 

His shop is situated in a well-populated area and many customers are available here to buy miscellaneous general-store items. He wants to cope with the demand successfully, but for this purpose some stock is required. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in the daily routine. In this way, he will be successful in winning the trust of his customers and will increase his income as well. 

He wants to offer additional items such as bread, jam, a few stationery items, soft drinks, and ice cream. But he does not have enough money to buy the described items.Therefore, Kashif Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy additional items such as bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks, ice creams, etc.

He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item and can abstain from the disappointment of his customers.  Kashif Ali is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, and he assures us that he will pay all installments due in his first loan with regularity

loans.use: A loan helps Kashif Ali to buy rice, bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks, ice cream, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan, 39, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Nhan and her husband earn money through their business of making clothing. Nhan would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of cloth and sewing materials to make clothes to meet her customers' needs. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of cloth and sewing materials to make and sell clothes

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is a 52-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife support their family by selling beef. Minh would like to get a loan to buy better quality beef to sell in his shop to better meet his customers' needs. He hopes that the loan will help him to increase his income and save money.

loans.use: to buy better quality beef to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 55-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. She has been working as a housekeeper for many years cleaning houses upon client’s request. In parallel, and as a wish to augment her income, she works as a housekeeper at a local bank. Her husband works as a car mechanic. 

Even though, the family’s income is barely adequate, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l with the intention of enhancing her way of work by purchasing new cleaning tools and a machine to clean carpets. Marie is an optimistic person who always seeks the best for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase new cleaning tools and a machine to clean carpets

loans.name: Heaven Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is the featured borrower of Heaven's group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines seeking work to provide their families with a better living. 

Jocelyn is 39 years old and married, the mother of five children.  She works as a housekeeper to provide her children with the best education and living.

Jocelyn's loan will be sent to her family back in Philippine husband and children, to cover their school and financial needs. She is working hard so that one day she'll buy her own beautiful house for her family in the Philippines.

She is the lady with red top at the right of the picture. As for the other group members, Florita is the lady with the grey top, and Corina is the first from the left.

loans.use: to send money back to her children in the Philippines to cover their school and financial needs

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed, about 34 years old, is the group leader of a three-member group from Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a grocery shop. Her family is comprised of six members, including her husband and two sons, ages about 6 and 8 years. 

The member standing in middle with raising hand is Naheed. Her husband helps a lot in her business to earn their livelihood. She is a very active lady who wants her husband to get some extra income from the grocery shop.

Naheed, along with two other members of her town, formed a group and this is their fifth loan from BRAC Pakistan for the development of their existing business. At present, her family monthly income is very low, and not sufficient to manage her family and to keep pace with the present society.

To improve her living conditions and earn some extra income, she wants to take a loan. With the loan, she will add some grocery items like rice, pulses (legumes), flour, sugar, wheat, sugar, tea, etc. to the existing business of her husband. 

Naheed thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: A portion of Naheed Group's loan helps a member to purchase rice, pulses, flour, sugar, wheat, sugar, tea, etc for the grocery shop of her husband.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is a 51-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has a daughter and four sons; her husband does work in a firm at low wages.

She owns a small business of selling ladies’ ready-made garments at home. She purchases ready-made garments from the market at a low price and sells them at a high price. The ladies of the town like her clothing collection and selection a lot and demand more variety. Her husband affords all the expenses from his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

She requested a loan so that she could buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand.

Anwer wishes for the bright future of her children, and her dream is to provide a better education to them.  

She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy winter weather clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mehran Naz

texts.en:
Mehran Naz is a 22-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a heart patient, and she always worries about his health. 

For seven years, her husband has run a welding shop, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Brac Pakistan. Mehran Naz will use her portion to help her husband in purchasing welding material as needed for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit, he will open a new shop for his son.

Mehran Naz dreams for her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health. She wants to say that BRAC is working very well in the field of microfinance, and she is very thankful to BRAC and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: to buy welding material for her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia belongs to an ultra poor family and lives with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories, which are used for houses, doors, and windows. With the help of a welding plant, he has been making iron doors and windows in addition to fixing broken accessories.

Recently, his welding plant was broken due to overheating, and he wants to buy new welding plant. He does not have the money due to lot of household expenses. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a portion of Razia's Group's loan helps a member to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.

loans.name: M. Afzal

texts.en:
M. Afzal is a milkman by profession and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk for many years, and now he is very experienced in his profession. He is very expert in getting milk from a buffalo; he gets it from all his buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes, which is the reason he has to work very hard to arrange fodder for the herd. 

His is taking a loan for the establishment of business and to increase his herd. He still wants to establish his business further and wants to buy more heifers so that he can increase his monthly income and savings as well. He decided to buy heifers because a heifer is cheaper than a buffalo and they grow up in a short time. He will feed them in a better way and he will pay his full devotions for heifers, he hopes that they will grow up soon and he can get milk from them. 

Therefore, M. Afzal requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that he will be able to buy heifers and that he will succeed in increasing his monthly income and his herd as well. He thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy heifers to increase his herd.

loans.name: M. Saeed

texts.en:
M. Saeed is aged of 34, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is very hardworking and gentle person. He is responsible for his five children and old parents as well. 

He is a milkman by profession and supplies milk in his community. He has been selling milk for many years and now he is very expert and experienced about his profession. He is very expert in getting milk from a buffalo; he gets it from all his buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to work very hard to feed them. He has to spend a large part of his income on fodder; he appointed an assistant as well. Every day his assistant takes all the buffaloes to the pasture for grazing and gives them baths in the stream; he has to stay with his buffaloes the whole day due to fear of theft. 

M. Saeed is taking a loan to buy a cow to increase the herd and also use a portion for fodder. This way he can increase his monthly income and savings as well. Therefore, he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; so that he could buy a cow. M. Saeed gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a cow to get more milk.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives in a poor area in Taiz, Yemen. 

She has been working in the public sector with a monthly salary that she uses to support her family. She works hard daily, and she loves her career.  

She is requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance her skills in using the computer and speed the process of doing reports for her work, which will ensure better conditions for her work. 

This will ensure a better future and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: M. Saqib

texts.en:
M. Saqib is a 26-years old man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He works hard to provide better living standards to his family by selling gift hampers and decoration pieces. He purchases all gifts and decoration pieces from the market and then sells it to the general public. Most of the sales he made at festivals, occasions and on ceremonies. He has become famous by providing good quality gifts and has retained many customers. He earns enough money to support a decent life. During this tenure he experienced that most of his female customers demand for the beauty products a lot. This is the reason he decided to offer cosmetics products also with the gift hampers. 

Therefore, he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that he could offer beauty products also with gift hampers. This is his first loan and he assured us to pay all the installments on due time. He is very experienced in his business and confident that his business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.
He is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products to sell

loans.name: Ayshah

texts.en:
Ayshah is 51 years old and a widow from a small area in Gaza city. She is the mother of three young sons. 

Ayshah works as an employee to afford the living expenses for her and her sons. She gets a low income, which is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Ayshah has a problem in her leg joints, and she needs to take some medicine and do a surgery.

Ayshah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of surgery for her legs. This will help her to go back to work and do all her daily activities.
 
Ayshah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of surgery for her leg joints

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man who has been working in selling accessories, stationery and silver since June 2012. 

This is his only source for living; that's why he works hard to develop his business in a well-managed way to attract more customers.

Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special silver designs and household appliances.

This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. He hopes that through a future relationship with Al Majmoua, he will work hard on expanding his working sector and diversify his products more to increase his income.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special silver designs and household appliances.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is the 45-year-old married father of two children.

He has been working in the aluminum business since 1990. Issam is a hard worker who puts so much effort into supporting his family and providing them with the best education and living.

Issam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner's Al Majmoua, to pay his children's school fees. His business is going on just fine, but he needs Al Majmoua's support to pay for the increasing school fees.

As for the future, Issam will invest an additional push to move forward, through a future-acquired loan from Al Majmoua.

This is his fourth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing paying-back history.

Issam is working hard to renew all of his machines and add new released ones to develop his business and expand it in a well managed way.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to use for his grocery store.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is age 24, and along with her husband, Shibeshwar, is raising her two children. Nilima and Sibeshwar both received education until class VII (grade 8). Both the children go to school and are in primary classes. They stay in a kaccha house (house made of mud, bamboo, straw, etc.).

Nilima wants to farm potatoes. With this loan, she will buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, with the profit she earns from her business, she wants to build a concrete house so that her children can have a better lifestyle. Nilima hopes that with the loan money, she can manage to expand their business without any problems. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for the loan. She has proved that it is not that difficult to see the light by overcoming hurdles if financial assistance is received.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 43-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has one buffalo, and sells milk, along with the butter she makes from the milk, to many of her neighbors.
