George hopes his initiative will be lucrative and be able to increase family funds.

George and his family members are awaiting your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk for resale.

loans.name: 02.05.03 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hào  is 23 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.
 

Hào operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

Hào is the group leader of the 02.05.03 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members.  This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start up a café in Tirana catered to Albanian youth with disabilities, providing them with a friendly environment in which to work, socialize and showcase artistic and musical talents.

loans.name: Salah Ahmed

texts.en:
Salah Ahmed is 19 years old. He studies at Alpha University College, faculty of Business Administration. 

He needs a laptop to prepare assignments and read lessons when given in software copy. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students the software copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. 

He cannot pay the money all at one time. He approached Kaaba MFI. Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: 02.04.05 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Thêu is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Thêu is the group leader of the 02.04.05 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

Thêu has a service business shipping goods. Thêu has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thêu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2012, Thêu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thêu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to do a sand-shipping service. 

With her business profit, Thêu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a sand-shipping service.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru:
59-летняя Мунавар занимается древним ремеслом - шитьем курпа и курпача. Это ватные стеганые одеяла, которые до сих пор являются главными бытовыми предметами в доме у таджиков. Курпача стелится на пол и используется вместо кресел, а курпа используется зимой в качестве одеяла во время сна. Мунавар занимается этим ремеслом в течение 5 лет. Ей в деятельности помогает единственная дочь. Мунавар замужем и имеет еще двоих сыновей. Она проживает со своей семьей районе Б.Гафуров города Худжанд. 
Услуга Мунавар всегда востребованная. Особенно когда люди устраивают свадьбу они в качестве приданого для будущей невесты или для своей дочери, выходящей замуж шьют на заказ курпа и курпача. Поэтому деятельность Мунавар день за днем расширяется и сейчас она нуждается в кредите. Мунавар собирается закупить хлопок и сшить большое количество ватных стеганых одеял.
texts.en:
Munavar is 59 years old and does an old craft, she sews quilts called kurpa and kurpacha. These are cotton quilts which are still the main household items in the homes of Tajiks. Kurpacha is put on the floor and is used instead of chairs, and kurpa is used in the winter as a quilt for sleeping. Munavar has been doing this for five years. Her only daughter helps her in the business. Munavar is married and also has two sons. She lives with her family in the region of Gafurov in the town of Khujand.

Munavar's service is always in demand. Especially when people hold wedding celebrations they make kurpa and kurpacha as a dowry for the future bride or their daughter who is getting married. This is why Munavar's business is growing day by day and now she needs a loan. Munavar wants to buy cotton to sew a large quantity of cotton quilts.

loans.use: to purchase cotton for sewing of cotton quilts.

loans.name: 03.01.18 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Huệ is 25 years old and married with one child. She lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Huệ operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.  Huệ has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

In 2012, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ is the group leader of the 03.01.18 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy. She also would like to remodel her house,

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: 03.02.03 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hòa is 37 years old and she is married with two children. She supports her two dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has a retail business selling various items. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase various items to resell.  In 2012, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 03.02.03 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase various items to resell.

loans.name: Elizah

texts.en:
Elizah operates a food vending business, selling at the market to market dwellers and passersby. In addition, she has a retail shop business. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future and she appreciates the previous loan, which helped her to repair her retail premises.

With the KES 60,000 she wants to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour for the business.

loans.name: Zulisma

texts.es: Zulisma de 57 años de edad habita muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vende comidas rápidas, en un vehículo que ubica a un lado de su vivienda. Ella tiene tres años de experiencia y  con sus hijos, quien estudia técnica de cocina, se les ocurrió poner en práctica lo aprendido, teniendo en cuenta los productos que mas usualmente consumen en su población objeto. Así fue como a falta de un empleo decidieron que su hijo generaría sus propios ingresos familiares apoyándolo con el primer capital, con el cual les ha ido muy bien. Sus ventas las realizan de contado desde las 4 de la tarde a las 2 de la mañana de viernes a domingos y cuando es feriado.  Sus compras las hace a mayoristas y sus ventas las realiza directamente a sus vecinos del sector que son los clientes principales. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local, donde agregarle muchos mas productos que su hijo ha aprendido en  sus  estudios técnicos, para aumentar sus ingresos y poder apoyar a su familia, tanto como sea posible. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  4 juegos de mesas y sillas plásticas, e insumos de comidas rápida, como embutidos, salsas, grasas lácteos etc.  Con esta inversión logrará un mejor servicio a su clientela y dar respuesta a la enorme demanda que se avecina, en los meses de noviembre, Diciembre y Enero, épocas de fiestas, en la cual los estudiantes y muchos de los miembros de sus familias, se encuentran de vacaciones, y consumen mucho mas los deliciosos productos rápidos  que se preparan en el negocio de Zulisma. Lo cual hace que su credikiva, tenga mucho potencial de exitoso.
texts.en: Zulisma, 57, lives very close to the city of Barranquilla where she sells fast food from a vehicle that is located on one side of her house. She has three years experience and, with her children, who study culinary art, it has occurred to them to practice what they've learned taking into account the products most consumed by their target market. Due to a lack of employment, they decided that her son would generate his own family income supporting the business with the first capital with which they have done very well. Their sales are made in cash from 4 in the afternoon until 2 in the morning from Friday to Sunday and when it is a holiday. They make their purchases at wholesale and make sales directly to their neighbors in the area who are their main customers. Her future goal is to open a restaurant where she can add many more products that her son has learned in his studies in order to expand their income and be able to support her family as much as possible. Currently, she is applying for a loan, the first loan she's made with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy four sets of plastic tables and chairs and ingredients for fast food such as sausages, sauces, dairy fat,etc. With this investment, she will achieve better service for her customers and respond to the enormous demand that approaches in the months of November, December and January, the holiday season, when students and many members of their families are on vacation and consume a lot more of the delicious fast products that are prepared in Zulisma's business, which means her loan has potential for success.

loans.use: to buy four sets of plastic tables and chairs, ingredients for fast food like sausages, sauces, dairy fat etc.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: 63-year-old Aurelia is a married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She has two grown children and relies on hog raising for an income. For three years now, this is her livelihood. Aurelia is requesting a loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos to buy piglets to be added to her piggery. With the availability of additional capital, Aurelia will have the chance to expand her business and make the most out of her investment. Her income will provide savings and healthy food for herself and her husband. Aurelia dreams of making her business bigger to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Rafiq Masih

texts.en:
Rafiq Masih is 48 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for many years near his house and the business is operating very well. 

Earlier, he was selling bakery items in large quantity, but according to the customers' demand, he wants to offer rice, sugar, flour, etc. also. He does not want to refuse any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products that are necessary and consumable in daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well.
 
Therefore, Rafiq Masih requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy the sacks of rice, sugar and flour. He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.
 
Rafiq Masih is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and he assures that he will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sugar and flour for the general store.

loans.name: Ayan Ahmed

texts.en:
Ayaan Ahmed is 20. She studies information technology at Alpha University College, and she is a senior student.

Her problem is that she has no laptop, and it’s difficult for her to practice. She has informed Kaaba-Kiva laptop loans and she would like to have a laptop as a loan. She approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Hodo Aden

texts.en:
Hodo Aden is 26. She studies information technology at Alpha University College and she is a senior student. 

Her problem is that she has no laptop, and it’s difficult for her to practice and also to prepare the research paper of her graduation. She has informed Kaaba-Kiva laptop loans, and she would like to have a laptop as a loan. She approached Kaaba MFI, and Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is single and has two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

For the past four years, Emily has operated a food vending business selling fried potatoes at the market to market dwellers and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase cooking fat and wheat flour for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri  est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les médicaments, les condiments les chaussures, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
 Kadia  est un membre du groupe Tièssiri accroupie au bout à gauche, elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chaussures en gros. Elle se procure de ces marchandises au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend en détail et en gros,  au comptant et à crédit à la maison  et au marché à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 62 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadia compte réaliser  63 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Tiessiri is a collective of women from the Koko district of the city of Koutiala. These women live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. On average, they are 28 years old, married and have at least four children. This group of women trades in various items, such as medication, condiments, shoes etc. In order to increase the size of their business, the members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit initiative. This is their first group loan. 

Kadia, a member of the Tiessiri Group, is the woman squatting down in the bottom-left of the photo. She intends to use this loan to buy shoes in bulk. She procures this merchandise from the Koutiala main market. She sells in both retail and wholesale, accepting cash and credit, working from home and at market, to a diverse and varied client base. Whereas the other group members intend to each earn an average profit of 62,000 CFA during the loan period, Kadia intends to earn 63,000 CFA. On top of paying back the loan, they will use part of the revenue to pay for personal expenses and to grow their business.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Ahmadah

texts.en:
Ahmadah is 42 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the  region of Masaka in Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Ahmadah has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells home products. 

To help expand his business, Ahmadah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of sugar, rice, maize flour and groundnuts for the shop, and it will help Ahmadah to generate greater profits and to buy home necessities. Ahmadah hopes that in the future, he will be able to open up another retail shop in Masaka town. 

Ahmadah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ahmadah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sugar, rice, maize flour and groundnuts for the shop.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en: Anastase is a father of two children. He sells various items in his boutique. With this loan, he is planning to buy more cooking oil and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Dolores Elizabet

texts.es:
Dolores, es una persona que vive junto a su padre y sus hermanos en una casa familiar que pertenece a su papá, en su afán por ayudar en los gastos de su hogar emprendió un proyecto en el que instalo un pupuseria, venta de panes y tortillas, atiende el negocio sola, en ocasiones le ayudan sus cuñadas, el negocio está ubicado en su residencia.
Comprará maíz, frijoles, quesillo, pollo, tomates, cebolla, repollo, etc. Son su materia prima para que el negocio funcione y siga dándole ganancias que utilizara para ir cancelando sus cuotas y aportar más en los gastos de su casa.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio, clientes satisfechos y cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Dolores is a person who lives with her father and brothers in a family home that belongs to her father. In her eagerness to help with the expenses of the home, she launched a project in which she opened a pupusa store selling breads and tortillas. She tends the shop alone, though on occasion her sisters-in-law help her. The business is located in her home.

She will purchase corn, beans, quesillo (a soft Salvadorian cheese), chicken, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, etc. This is her raw material because of which the business functions and continues to give her profits that she will use to make her payments and contribute more to pay the home expenses.

She dreams of having a larger business, satisfied customers, and to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, quesillos, chicken, tomatoes, onions, and cabbage.

loans.name: Belizario

texts.es:
Belezario tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado a 20 minutos de Pucará, su población sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, perteneciendo a Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El es conocido por la labor que realiza, tiene un taller ubicado en su domicilio de carpintería metálica, elabora diferentes productos de metales como puertas, ventanas, escaleras, tiene una familia unida, su hijo mayor brinda el servicio de transporte en la mototaxi de la familia.

Nos explica que está solicitando un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para compra de materiales y herramientas para carpintería y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Belezario is 60 years old and lives together with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca, located 20 minutes from Pucará, Perú.  The main activities in the area involve agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock.  He is situated in Jaén, in the mountains to the north of Perú.

He is known for his work and his metallic carpenter's shop, located in his home.  He makes different metal products like doors, windows, and stairs.  He has a very close family, and his oldest son offers transportation services via the family's motorcycle taxi.

He explains that he is asking for a loan of 3500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to purchase materials and tools for carpentry and in this way he will be able to improve his family income.

loans.use: To purchase metal materials and tools for carpentry.

loans.name: Maria Yudith

texts.es:
María, vive junto a su mamá y su hermana, se dedica a vender zapatos y sandalias para ambos sexos en variedad de estilos, colores y tallas, desde hace mucho está ejerciendo está actividad económica, por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema para realizarla.
Comprará zapatos tenis, sandalias, zapatos para niños y así tendrá un inventario muy surtido para que sus clientes puedan quedar satisfechos con sus productos, generara mayores ventas y mejores ingresos.
Anhela tener ingresos que le permitan cancelar la deuda y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
María lives with her mother and her sister. She makes a living selling shoes and sandals for both sexes in a variety of styles, colors, and sizes. For a long time she has been practicing this economic activity. For the moment she has not had any problems carrying it out.

She will purchase sneakers, sandals, children’s shoes, and so will have a well-supplied inventory. Her customers can then be satisfied with her products, which will generate higher sales and a better income.

She aspires to have a higher income that will allow her to pay off her loan and to purchase her own home.

loans.use: to purchase sneakers, sandals, and shoes for children.

loans.name: Ana Rosario

texts.es:
Ana de 35 años de edad, esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la albañilería, al mismo tiempo trabaja en las actividades agrícolas. Ana estudio hasta noveno grado de educación, con esta preparación se defiende  en sus labores diarias. Dejo los estudios para ayudarle a sus padres, en las actividades agrícolas y mas tarde se acompaño con su actual pareja.  Con ella viven sus dos hijos, el mayor esta estudiando cuarto grado.
Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la escuela del cantón. Vende panes con pollo, golosinas, jugos naturales entre otros productos. Anteriormente, le habían dado trabajo como vendedora en una pequeña tienda; pero prefirió tener su propio negocio, desde hace 10 años tiene ese negocio en esa escuela. El negocio se encuentra a cuadra y media de su casa y trabaja ahí de lunes a viernes.
Ana necesita el crédito para invertir, en la compra de mas insumos, para surtir su negocio, para vender en su casa, ya que se ha terminado la temporada escolar y ya no vende en la escuela. Por tal razón, quiere invertir en este negocio aprovechando así la época navideña. De esta manera, ella podrá seguir trabajando  y recibiendo ingresos para su familia.
Ella desea que su negocio se amplíe y que esto le pueda generar ingresos suficientes, para cubrir con las necesidades básicas de su familia. Que sus hijos puedan lograr estudiar y sacar estudios universitarios que les permita tener mas oportunidades de empleo  o de comenzar un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Ana, 35, is in a relationship and her partner is dedicated to masonry. At the same time he performs agricultural work. Ana stayed in school up to the ninth grade. With this preparation she fends for herself in her daily work. She left school to help her parents with farm work and, later, accompanied her current partner. Her two children live with her. The eldest is in the fourth grade. She has a small store in the area's school. She sells breads with chicken, candies, natural juices, among other products. Previously, they had given her work as a seller in a small shop but she preferred to have her own business. For ten years, she has had this business in the school. The business is located a block and a half from her house and she works there from Monday to Friday. 

Ana needs the loan to invest in the purchase of more items to stock her business to sell from her house since the school year has ended and she doesn't sell in the school anymore. For that reason, she wants to invest in this business taking advantage of the holiday season. In this way, she will be able to keep working and receiving income for her family.

She wishes that her business expands and that this can generate sufficient income to cover the basic necessities of her family, that her children can continue their education and go to university which will allow them to have more job opportunities or start their own business.

loans.use: to buy items needed to install a shop in her house.

loans.name: Servelio

texts.es: Servelio, tiene  43 años de edad, esta casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar con volquetas en acarreo de materiales de construcción como tierra, arena, piedra, grava y otros. Hace 8 años que tiene su propio vehículo para prestar el servicio de acarreo de materiales. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar llantas para la volqueta y poder prestar un mejor servicio y mejorar los ingresos. Su sueño es comprar una volqueta mas para trabajar.
texts.en: Servelio is 43 years old and is married.  He has three children and lives in the city of Choloma, Cortes.  He has always worked with dump trucks carrying construction materials such as dirt, sand, rock, gravel and other items.  For the past eight years he has had his own vehicle for offering transport and construction material services.  The loan that he is requesting is for 15,000 Lempiras (Honduran currency), which will be used to buy tires for the dump truck and to be able to offer better service and thus receive better income.  His dream is to buy another dump truck in order to take on more work.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his dump truck used for transporting construction materials.

loans.name: Essivi

texts.fr: Madame Essivi âgée de 36ans est mariée à un chauffeur et père de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Pour contribuer aux besoins du ménage, elle revend des produits alimentaires, des couches pour bébé et autres produits au marché. N'arrivant plus à bien répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère à l'avenir, avoir un grand étalage et bien s'occuper de la famille.
texts.en: Essivi, who is 36 years old, is married to a driver and mother to three children who are all at school. In order to be able to contribute to the household expenses, she sells food products, babies' diapers and other products at the market. Since she is no longer able to meet customer demand, she is requesting a first loan to buy more stock. She hopes in the future to have a large stall and also to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products, babies' diapers and shoes.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 28 años, está casada con Virgilio de 30 años junto a sus dos pequeños en su casa propia hecha a base de madera.Es una mujer dedicada íntegramente a las actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico en su localidad. Desempeña esta labor desde muy niña y desde hace dos años cuenta con un terreno propio y se encuentra próxima a proceder con la cosecha de algunos productos. Sus tareas agrícolas las desempeña principalmente con el apoyo de su esposo y trabajadores quienes apoyan también en tareas de deshierbo y  traslado de las cosechas puestos en sacos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 28 years old and is married to Virgilio, 30 years old. They live together with their two small children in a house made of wood, which they own. She makes her living entirely through agricultural activities, producing organic cacao and coffee in her area. She has been doing this type of work since she was a girl; she has had her own plot for two years, and she is about to start harvesting some crops. She handles her agricultural tasks mainly with the help of her husband and workers, who also help with weeding and transporting the crops, which have been put into sacks. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva; she is thankful for the financial help that she receives to keep moving ahead, and she is committed to making her payments on time. For this loan, she is requesting 1,000 nuevos soles to by organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 28 years old. He is unmarried and he lives alone.  Armen has graduated from Yerevan State University .  Following several years of hard and devoted work,  he now is working in a hydro-electrical station. Simultaneously, he is engaged in farming. On his farm he has cows, piglets, and chickens, and he takes care of them perfectly. 

Armen has decided to get a decent income with the coming of the New Year. This is the reason for requesting a second loan with Kiva. He asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a quantity of animal fodder for his piglets. He plans to feed them for half a month and then sell them.  Armenian people make their  main New Year’s dish from pork, so  that is why the demand for pork is so great during that period.

loans.use: to buy a quantity of animal fodder for his piglets

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola tiene 53 años de edad, vive en Santa Julia una zona rural de Morropon, los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y ventas de todo tipo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un bodeguita en su domicilio donde ofrece abarrotes y venta de pollo pelado y carne de res, nos explica que se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su bodega con la compra de frutas y verduras y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bartola is 53 years old and lives in Santa Julia, a rural zone of Morropon.  Residents in the area work raising cattle and in commerce and sales of all kinds.  They are located two hours from the city of Piura, along the northern coast of Perú. 

Bartola has a small store in her home where she offers groceries and sells chicken and beef.  She explains that she has been working in this field for ten years.  

She is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to supply her store with fruits and vegetables and in this way have a better income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, including fruits and vegetables, in order to supply her store.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Netor tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en Macuaco una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

En su domicilio tiene una bodega donde ofrece venta de abarrotes, con la ayudad e su hija mayor elaboran helados con frutas de la zona.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar una vitrina congeladora para exhibir los helados y postres que piensan elaborar y de esta manera captar más clientes , generando ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Netor is 46 years old and lives with his two children in Macuaco, a rural zone in the district of Oyotun.  The population there works raising small livestock and in agriculture.  The town is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

In his home Netor has a store where he sells groceries, and with the help of his oldest daughter they make ice cream with fruit from the area.  

He is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to purchase a display case freezer in order to exhibit their ice creams and the desserts that they are planning to make. In this way he will attract more customers, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer display case.

loans.name: Charly

texts.fr: Charly est un homme de 33 ans marié, père de deux enfants de 2 et 4 ans. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'il gère depuis 8 ans déjà. il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques,tondeuses et petit matériel dans son institut parce qu'il achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. il sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en: Charly is a 33-year-old married man and father of two children aged two and four. After finishing his training, he opened a hairdressers, which he has been running for eight years. He often has problems within his business due to a lack of cosmetic products, hair clippers and everyday items because he buys his products in small amounts. His goal is to satisfy his clientele and to make a large profit. He has requested a loan in order to be able to buy his equipment in large quantities, which will allow him to reach his targets. The profits made from this loan will help him to satisfy both his and his family's needs, as well as leaving him with some savings to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and everyday items in order to fix up his hairdressing business

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.fr: Leocadie est une femme de 49 ans veuve et  mère de 5 enfants. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, bananes et plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter un pick-up des régimes de plantainset bananes pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Leocadie is a 49-year old widow who is mother to five children. She is a trader and has for the past ten years been selling fresh food products (cassava, bananas and plantain bananas) according to the season, in a local market. She knows her suppliers, and above all, her customers which she has acquired over time due to her experience in this field, well. However she faces a constant stock shortage because she is obliged to sell off all her goods before being able to replenish her stock as a result of the small amount of her capital. She would like to buy a pick-up for bunches of bananas and plantain bananas to enable her to have a good stock and better satisfy her customers' constant demand as well as to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to be able to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a pick up for bananas and plantain bananas.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.fr: Rachel est une femme de 52 ans mariée, mère de famille. Elle commerçante et vend du poissons à la braise en soirée depuis17 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (, 2 cartons de poisson, un bidon d'huile, les condiments et le bois de chauffage) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Rachel is a 52-year old woman who is married and a mother. She is a trader who has been selling braised fish at evening parties for the past 17 years in one of the capital's districts. Her know-how in this field and her prices have enabled her to acquire and hold on to a loyal customer base which is steadily growing. She wants this loan because her capital is insufficient to fully satisfy customer demand. Thanks to the loan she will be able to increase her stock by buying two cartons of fish, a container of oil, condiments and firewood. The profits she makes from this loan will be partly reinvested in her business, with the remainder being saved for her children's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock (of fish, oil, condiments and wood).

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene  25 años de edad,  vive en unión de hecho con su pareja y  tienen  dos hijos de tres  y seis años de edad, el mayor  se encuentra estudiando y viven en Sololá.
Ella se dedica al cultivo de  verduras como zanahoria, papa y maíz, para después  cosecharlos y comercializarlos en el lugar de su residencia, lo realiza  desde hace 6 años ya que estas verduras mantienen mejores precios en el mercado, quiere seguir cultivando estas verduras en mas lugares para obtener mejores ganancias, por lo que ahora está solicita un crédito de Q 3,000.00 quetzales,  para la compra de una cuerda de zanahoria para luego comercializarlo y así poder mejorar sus ganancias.
Sueña con tener una vivienda mejorada  y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que en un futuro se puedan desarrollar en un trabajo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 25 years old and lives with her life partner.  They have two children ages three and six, and the oldest is in school.  They live in Sololá.  She works growing vegetables like carrots, potatoes and corn.  She harvests and sells them in her place of residence.  She has been doing this work since she was six years old.  Since the vegetables maintain better prices at market, she wants to continue cultivating vegetables in more places in order to obtain better income. That is why she is asking for a loan of 3000 quetzales  (Guatemalan currency).  The money will be used to purchase a cord of carrots in order to sell them and thus improve her income. 

She dreams of having a better home and helping her children in their studies so that in the future they can develop in their work.

loans.use: To purchase a cord of carrots in order to sell them.

loans.name: Lurgia

texts.es:
Lurgia tiene 21 años, está casada con Rafael y tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de adobe. Se dedica junto a su esposo al oficio de la agricultura en su terreno de una hectárea y media que sus padres le cedieron desde joven al tener la responsabilidad de mantenerse económicamente.  Posee una buena variedad de productos como son el cacao, café, barbasco y árboles frutales que produce con el permanente apoyo de su pareja. Lleva más de 5 años en el rubro y a medida que fueron pasando los años el precio de sus productos ha presentado una mejoría logrando obtener mejores ingresos, no obstante debe también invertir en la compra de abono orgánico y herramientas en cada campaña productiva. Es el tercer préstamo que solicita a kiva y se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. 
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de un pequeño terreno cercano a su localidad donde planea expandir sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Lurgia is 21 years old. She is married to Rafael and they have three children. They all live in a house made with adobe. She and her husband work in agriculture. They own a one-and-a-half hectares piece of land they inherited from their parents when they were young but responsible enough to sustain themselves economically. Together, they grow a wide variety of crops, such as cocoa, coffee, varbasco [common mullein] and different fruit trees.

Lurgia has been doing this for more than five years and with time, the price of these products has improved, resulting in a better income. However, she must invest in organic fertilizer and tools every harvesting season. This is her third loan with Kiva and she feels confident about the future of her business.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy a small piece of land close to where she lives, in which she is planning to grow more cocoa.

loans.use: to buy a small piece of land where to grow cocoa.

loans.name: And Liggey Group

texts.fr: Le GIE And Liggey est composé de 5 personnes habitant dans le même quartier et se réunissent  a chaque fois de besoin. Adja Khady est leur présidente, elle est brave et évolue dans l’aviculture. Elle a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment pour les élever et les revendre ensuite. Mariée et mère de famille, Adja a une expérience de plus de 04ans dans cette activité. Elle n’a aucunes charges familiales car c’est son mari qui s’occupe des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et des frais de scolarité de leurs enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 19h pour la terminer à 17h. A l’avenir elle souhaite avec l’aide des crédits aménager un champ ou elle pourrait cultiver et élever des animaux de bétail afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: The And Liggey group is made up of five people who live in the same neighborhood and who get together whenever necessary. Adja Khady is their president, and she is a courageous woman who has developed a poultry farming activity. She needs this loan to buy chickens and food to raise them and subsequently sell them on. Married and a mother, Adja has more than four years' experience in this business. She has no family expenses as her husband takes care of the family's daily outgoings and their children's schooling. She begins her day at 9 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 5 o'clock in the afternoon. In the future, she would with help of loans, like to have a field where she could farm and raise livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy chickens for raising and selling on.

loans.name: 03.01.20 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Len is 59 years old and married with three children. Len lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Len operates a business selling vegetables. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Len faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

In 2012, Len joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 03.01.20 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members.

With her business profits, Len hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
This is Raymund, 30, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Single, he works hard to provide for his everyday needs. He is also helping his parents and siblings financially. 

Raymund operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one package of shampoo, five PHP (Philippines Pesos)-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. He also has a bakery. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 900 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Raymund hopes to have other branches and dreams of becoming rich. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, when he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Dionabeth

texts.en:
Every day, Dionabeth goes to the market to purchase the products she sells. When she arrives back at her home she proceeds to sell her products by walking around her village and shouting “meat, fish, bibingka kayo dyan mga suki." She is happy that, after two years, she is still operating her business. Now, she also sells cellular loads for different phone networks as an additional source of income.

At present, Dionabeth wishes to have her own stall for selling meat, fish, and snack foods and to restart her closed sari-sari (variety) store business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 42,000 to buy fish, meat, and snack foods to sell. Her priority for now is her children's education, but she will not stop striving for her dream of finishing her house to create a comfortable living space. Dionabeth has not lost her hope that someday she will have another business to operate.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a farmer residing in Nkubu region, a very fertile area located at the slopes of Mt.Kenya. She has practiced farming for 17 years. Her income is being generated from the sale of milk and crops like bananas and potatoes. She enjoys the produce of her farm because it brings back good returns. What challenges her is lack of sufficient money to carry out farming activities.

Susan chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund her because they do offer good training to farmers before giving out the loans, and also, their loans have a lower interest rate. Susan said this loan will help her purchase a dairy goat, which will increase milk production and thus, increase her income. This will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer living in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. He has carried out farming for the past 22 years. His main sources of income come from milk production and crop production. He loves farming because, as long as the weather is favorable, his crops will do well and will produce more yield and therefore he will get more profit. The only challenge he faces is during seasons of drought.

John chose Juhudi Kilimo because of its low interest rates on loans. He also learned that he should develop a culture of savings. This loan will enable him to buy dairy goats so that they can produce milk for sale. This will build his income. He will be able to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Felrose

texts.en:
Felrose is 33 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Felrose has a fish/crab vending business in the Philippines. Felrose requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and crabs to sell. Felrose has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Felrose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 50 years old and married with six children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing business for 22 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 56 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for four years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Lilia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hasna Group

texts.en: Hasna is a four-member group. All of them are poor ladies from Aden, Yemen. Krima is a 29-year-old married woman who has children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and living in a poor area in Aden. Her house is very old and in a miserable situation. She has accumulated some money to renovate her house. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she is short of money. She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a loan of 50,000 YER [Yemen rials] to buy cement and carpentry materials. She hopes that after the completion of the house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement and carpentry materials to use for her house.

loans.name: Bether

texts.en:
Bether is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, Bether has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oumarou

texts.fr: Oumarou est une femme de 34 ans mariée, mère de familles. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place où elle vend des vivres frais et secs selon les saisons et aussi des poissons fumés  depuis 13 ans déjà. cette activité fonctionne à merveille c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grandes quantité ses poissons fumés (trois cartons) ce qui permettra d'augmenter de fonds de commerce, d'éviter les ruptures de stocks qu'elle rencontre souvent et surtout de réaliser un plus gros bénéfice. Profit qui sera en partie  économiser pour la scolarité de ses enfants, de subvenir aux besoins quotidien de sa famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en: Oumarou is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of a family. She is a merchant in a local market where she has been selling fresh and dried seasonal food, and also smoked fish, for 13 years. This business does extremely well. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan to buy a large quantity of smoked fish (three cartons). This loan will allow her to grow her business, avoid stock shortages -- which she often encounters -- and above all earn a higher income. Some of the profits will be saved for her children's schooling and to serve the everyday needs of her family. The rest will be reinvested into her business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of smoked fish

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman and has one child. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jane has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 25,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig is 31 years old. He has been married since seven years ago. His family lives at Boyuk Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region. It is already 20 years that Rafig’s family has been IDP (Internally Displaced Peoples) from their native land, Fuzuli. Rafig’s wife, Sahsenem, is a teacher of music. He has two sons; the elder son goes to first class, while another son goes to preschool. 

Rafig is a taxi driver; he is transporting passengers in the local Fuzuli reion. Today, he wants to increase his business, therefore, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 600 AZN [Azerbaijani new manat] to paint and repair his car.

He is thankful to the Kiva organization for the aid. In the future, he wants to change his car.

loans.use: to paint his car and repair it.

loans.name: Yorkinoy

texts.en:
Sewing is a most common kind of activity in Tajikistan. Women are mostly not allowed to go somewhere and work. That’s why they just sit in their houses and earn money by sewing the national clothes for women. 

Yorkinoy is a 24-year-old woman. Unfortunately, her husband died and they didn’t have kids. She wants to change everything in her house. She wants to repair her house because everything in there reminds her of him. That’s why she asks for the loan of 3,000 somoni to buy building materials for repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now. Analie requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Analie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is a farmer in a rural area, and he mainly grows pineapples, which is his major source of income. He is a married man and a father of eight children; six of them are in school. He works six days on the pineapple garden, and he works four hours per day, which gives him time to do work on his other business of cattle farming. 

Laban started growing pineapples in the year 1990, and he says his sweat has been rewarded by the pineapple growing business. He has been able to support his family, which is the main reason why he started the business. His clients are mainly business men and women from the same area, and his purpose for the loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings is to buy mulches for the pineapple garden so that it can produce better quality pineapples. 

Laban has a hope of completing his house so that he and the entire family can have a habitable place. Despite the unfavorable weather which affects him negatively, Laban is determined to achieve his goal in life.

loans.use: To buy mulches for his pineapple garden.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 43 years old. She is married with five children. She sells flour and has been in the business for the past one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used for providing food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more flour for sale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now. Anita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy another bicycle unit for her business. Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle unit for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an upholstery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like rubber, plastic, etc., for her upholstery business.

Elsa has been in this business for 38 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like rubber, plastic, etc

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is the married mother of two children, who are still young. She lives in her own house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereal-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase maize, wheat, rice, and sorghum for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize, wheat, rice, and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 36 years old. She is married with two children. She sells different items in her boutique and has been running the boutique business for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy only one product of Colgate for sale, and she hopes to become a distributor in the future. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more Colgate product for sale.

loans.name: 02.05.04 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Thỏa is 44 years old, married, with two children. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thỏa operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thỏa faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase fruit to resell. This is Thỏa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 02.05.04 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profits, Thỏa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell like sugar, milk, soap, bread, etc.

She has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending. Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell, like sugar, milk, soap, bread, etc.

loans.name: Leyla Azucena

texts.es:
Doña Leyla tiene 41 años de edad y su grado de educación primaria completa ya que ella no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de dinero debido que sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos para apoyarle en sus estudios ya que ella en su juventud viajaba distancias que requerían de gasto extra. Ella es casada y junto a su esposo tiene tres hijos que viven con ellos, La mayor tiene 22 años y solo llego hasta primaria ya que el estudio no le gusto aprendiendo a involucrarse desde muy temprana edad en los quehaceres de la casa y para la temporada de café en las diferentes actividades del campo, el segundo tiene 20 años y actualmente estudia a nivel superior medicina en su primer año y para la temporada de la cosecha del café él se involucra en las actividades de la corta, y la tercera tiene 17 años y está estudiando bachiller en ciencias y letras siendo este su último año y como los dos hermanos mayores también se involucra en las actividades de la corta de café. Doña Leyla se dedica al negocio del cultivo de café desde hace 20 años y obtuvo los conocimientos por medio de su esposo ya que también él es productor de café. La propiedad que en familia trabajan está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de su casa a la cual se traslada caminando. 
Doña Leyla sus metas son comprar más propiedad para seguir cultivando café mejorando sus condiciones de vida mediante la siembra de más plantilla de café y así poder obtener más ingresos para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y fortalecer el patrimonio para los mismos. Por lo que hoy día ella solicita financiamiento para poder comprar insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y de esa manera al final de la temporada obtener una excelente cosecha la cual ayude al cumplir sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Doña Leyla is 41 years old and has a complete level of primary school education although she could not continue studying because of lack of money and because her parents did not have enough resources to support her in her studies because in her youth, she traveled distances for school that required extra expense. She is married and she and her husband have three children living with them. The oldest is 22 years old and only studied in primary school because she did not like school. From an early age, this daughter learned to do household chores and to be involved in the activities of harvesting coffee. Her son is 20 and is currently studying at a higher level, in his first year of medicine. During harvest season, he becomes involved in the activities of the coffee harvest. Her third child is 17 and is in high school studying arts and sciences. She is in her last year of high school and, like her two siblings, is involved with the activities of the coffee harvest. Doña Leyla has earned her living growing coffee for 20 years and obtained her knowledge from her husband as he is also a producer of coffee. The property the family works is located 2 miles for her house. She gets there by walking.
Leyla's goals are to buy more property to continue growing coffee to improve their living conditions by planting more coffee plants so she can get more revenue to continue to support their children in their studies and to strengthen the estate for them. Today she is requesting funding to purchase agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops and get a bumper crop at the end of the season which will help to fulfill their goals and dreams.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years and she earns more income from fishing. She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, fish, etc. for her restaurant business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Marie Anne

texts.fr: Marie Anne est une femme de 57 ans fiancée mère de 4 enfants. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produits de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats, ainsi un nouvel équipement. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie Anne is 57 years old. She is engaged and is also the mother of four children. She owns her own restaurant, which she has run for years. It's thanks to this business that she is able to look after her family. Buying items for the restaurant in small quantities doesn't bring in much revenue for her. This is where the importance of this loan comes in. This loan will allow her to increase her stock of foodstuffs (sacks of peanuts, one sack of rice, a selection of fish and meats, raw vegetables and little extras needed for cooking her dishes) as well as new equipment. This will remove the need for daily shopping trips and cut down on her taxi expenses. This will also increase her profits. She will reinvest part of her profits into her business and the rest will help her meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and to also increase her stock

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is 50 years old, married and a father of four children living in the Ashkali community. Bajram is a very hard worker, as he works for the electrical company as a part time job and he also adds more income by working as a painter. He paints houses and different buildings when he has requests from clients. His wife is a housewife and a stay-at-home mother, taking care of the children and home. As most of the residents of their community, they live in very poor conditions in an old house. 

Now for the first time, Bajram is requesting a loan in order to renovate his house, changing the doors and windows before the winter time, as he always has a problem with drafts and the cold getting inside. The loan will help him to improve the living conditions for his family, keep them healthy in the cold, wet winter and save money on heating costs. He hopes in the future to find a stable job and secure money for his family's future. He wants to thank all of the lenders for this support which would have been impossible to accomplish by himself!

loans.use: To renovate his house by changing the doors and windows before winter time.

loans.name: Halime

texts.en:
Halime is 48 years old and married, with two children between the ages of thirteen and eighteen years old, both attending school. Her husband is working as a teacher and Halime has worked in milk production for more than five years. She collects milk from the neighborhood and then she sells it to a private company that works with milk products. She is collecting on an average, 300 liters per day and makes about 10% profit from the company. In addition she also keeps 3 milk cows of her own that she also uses their milk for selling to that big company.  

At this time, Halime is requesting a loan in order to renovate the place where she is storing the collected milk to enable her to store milk products better and prevent spoiling or decay for a longer time. She is very happy with her job and really enjoys working in agriculture. Her goal is to offer better living conditions for her family. She thanks all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To renovate the place where she is storing the collected milk.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira, age 40, is a married woman from the town of Kutaisi. She lives with her husband and a grown daughter and son. Ira earns her living through a clothing trading business which was started with a Kiva loan. Ira and her daughter sell the items from their house and have loyal clients from her community. In addition, the family gets social assistance from the local government as they live in poverty.

In order to improve her income, Ira is requesting this loan for purchasing a milk cow. She will start dairy farming and make cheese, yogurt and various products for selling as well as for family consumption. This initiative will increase her income and Ira will be able to improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start dairy farming.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is 41 years old and has two children who are attending school. To make a living, Delia has owned and operated a fishing business for eight years now. She also raises hogs for extra income. She catches and sells her fish in the market and in the neighborhood. 

Delia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment like fish net, and also feed for her hogs. She works hard for her children. She is optimistic that with the help of the loan, she can sustain her business and provide for her family's needs. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her business and to have other business options to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fish net and feed.

loans.name: Diappo 5 Group

texts.fr:
Madame Aida est la présidente du groupement Diappo 5 qui regroupe 5 personnes habitant dans le même quartier et se réunion pratiquement chaque fin de semaine. Elle évolue dans le commerce plus particulièrement dans la restauration. Madame Aida a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans cette activité. Elle a juste besoin de ce montant pour acheter du riz, huile, sucre et….
Elle commence sa journée à 7h du matin pour la terminer à 12h. Elle a comme charges ses 03 enfants et sa mère. A l’avenir elle souhaite développer d’avantage son activité et augmenter son restaurant afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aida is the president of the group Diappo 5, which consists of five members who live in the same neighborhood and who get together practically every week-end. Mrs. Aida’s commercial activity is a restaurant. She has over three years of experience in this activity, and only needs this loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, etc.

She starts her day at 7 AM and works until 12 PM. She supports her three children and her mother. 

In the long term, she wants to further develop her activity and expand her restaurant to meet customer demand and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, etc. for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ma. Febrica

texts.en:
Ma. Febrica is 58 years old. She lives in the Cabawan District of Tagbilaran City with her family. She is married and has four children, three of whom are adults and the youngest of whom is 17. 

Ma. Febrica works as a midwife and in a health center and she also operates a small drugstore that sells medicines for the people in her community. She is asking for a loan to buy more medicines for her drugstore. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business with affordable medicines so that she can help the people in her community even more.

loans.use: to buy more medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased quantities of soaps, milo, detergent, sugar, etc. in order to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store business and from raising pigs. 

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetable to resell. She has sustained her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. Elizabeth hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to resell

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emelda is 33 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Emelda has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 41 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, milk, soap, bread, etc.

She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, milk, soap, bread, etc.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leonisa works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling nipa (palm thatch) roofing in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store business. 

Leonisa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell in her nipa roofing business.

Leonisa has sustained her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Dingo

texts.en: Dingo is single. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He operates a camera shop business, taking people's photographs and printing them to get income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a digital camera for the business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 39 years old. She is married and has six children. She runs a canteen and has been selling snacks and soft drinks for the past two years. With this loan, Donatha would like to buy more sodas, milk, and bread for resale. With the profits from the business, she will provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sodas, milk, and bread for resale.

loans.name: Rodrigue

texts.fr: Rodrigue est un homme de 28 ans célibataire et père d'un enfant âgé de deux ans. il est commerçant et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomate, poisson, piment,condiments,etc) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 07 ans.il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'il a acquis au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais il se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'il est obligé de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital.Il souhaiterai augmenter son stock de vivres en achetant en gros ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. Bénéfice qu'il réinvestira en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Rodrigue is a 28-year-old man, unmarried, and a father of a 2-year-old child. He is a merchant and has been reselling fresh staple foods (tomatoes, fish, chili peppers, condiments, etc.) seasonally at a local market for seven years. He is very familiar with suppliers and especially his customers, whom he has acquired over the course of time thanks to his experience in this domain. But he constantly finds himself short of inventory, since he is compelled to sell all of it in order to procure more. This is due to his meager capital. He would like to increase his inventory of staple foods by purchasing in bulk. This will not only increase his sales but also his profits, of which some will be reinvested in his business to expand it. The rest will enable him to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies to increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette est une femme de 40 ans mère de famille, qui vit dans un quartier de la capital. Elle detient une boutique dans un coin de la place où elle vend des épices et autres divers produits depuis 9 ans. Grace à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter ( du pistache, du piment, du piment, du poivre et bien d'autres ). Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront de fluxtifer son capital, agrandir sa boutique et enfin d'améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.
texts.en: Henriette is a 40-year-old woman and a mother with a family. She lives in a district in the capital. She has a store on a corner where she has been selling spices and various other products for nine years. Thanks to her energy and competence in this domain, she has earned herself a growing customer base that she would like to continue to satisfy. To do so, she is requesting a loan enabling her to purchase pistachios, chili peppers, black pepper, and much more. The profits earned from this loan will enable her to mobilize her capital, to expand her store, and finally to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pistachios, chili peppers, and black pepper

loans.name: Mohamed Ahmed

texts.en: Mohamed Ahmed is 21 years old. He studies at Gollis University in the faculty of Information Technology. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and to read lessons when given in soft (electronic) copy. Buying a laptop on his own is the biggest challenge he has faced in his learning process. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students a soft copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide, which he will pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Rural economy is a main source of revenue in Tajikistan. Mostly people here are doing agribusiness a lot.  

Zafar is 28 years old man. It’s been six years already that he works at the farm. He got married very early like most people in Tajikistan. Now he has three  wonderful kids. His wife helps him with farm. They raise rice, cucumbers, wheat, etc.  

Zafar asks for the loan to refurbish his house so his family can be warmed up this winter. He is asking for a loan of TJS 6,000 to buy building materials for repairing his house.
